q.para: I want to compile Rllvm with a local, non-centrally installed version of llvm, e.g. a development version that I build in my own account area and not the one in that is installed /usr/local/. What do I have to do?

a.para:
The first thing to do is set the environment variable LLVM_CONFIG to the full path to the local version of llvm-config you want to use, e.g.
export LLVM_CONFIG=~/LLVM/build/Debug+Asserts/bin/llvm-config
Here I have put the source for llvm in LLVM/llvm, and configured and built it from a directory named build/.

If you have a version of llvm installed in /usr/local, you will need to force the local library directory to come before /usr/local/lib when building the shared library. R doesn't make this especially customizable, so we can force it by setting the Make variable SHLIB_LINK in our own local Makevars file in ${HOME}/.R, i.e. ${HOME}/.R./Makevars. We can do this with
SHLIB_LINK= $(SHLIB_LD) $(shell $(LLVM_CONFIG) --ldflags) $(SHLIB_LDFLAGS) $(LDFLAGS)

The last step is, of course, to ensure the system loader finds your local versions of the libraries. You need to set LD_LIBRARY_PATH, or DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH on OS X, or PATH on Windows, to point to the lib/ directory in your build, e.g.
export DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH=~/LLVM/build/lib/
